result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brendan Castaneda

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
11:09 a.m. Defendant Brendan Castaneda in court with attorney Robert A. Gardner. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
 Parties request PSI report for 15CF37 Ct 1. 15CF37 cts 2 - 4 and 15CF80 to be DRI.  Case 15CM234 and 14TR3727 to track along.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF37 Guilty and 15CF80 Guilty

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF37 Ct 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
 15CF37 cts 2 - 4 and 15CF80 are Dismissed Read In.  
Cases 15CM234 and 14TR3727 to track along.

BY THE COURT:***PSI report ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brendan Castaneda in court with attorney Robert A. Gardner. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CF-37, 15CM-234 and 15CF-80.

2:01 PM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Address of Defendant is verified.

Atty Cousins states matter was set for a plea today but received a phone call, stating Defendant is not ready to enter a plea today.

Atty Gardner addresses the Court, requests matter adjourned for reasons stated on the record, requests 30 days.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brendan Castaneda in court with attorney Robert A. Gardner. ADA Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
No contact with Wal-Mart in Plover, Wisconsin.  Comply with all bond conditions in 15CF37

Defendant Brendan Castaneda in court with attorney Robert A. Gardner. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:40 p.m. case s called and appearances stated on the record.
This is a return on warrant for failure to appear
Warrant is vacated by the court.
Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.

Attorney Gardner asks for preliminary hearing but time limits will be waived.
Underlying case is 15CF37 and has a hearing on 4-20-15 

Defendant Confirms address

1:45 p.m. case is concluded.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
